code:
sequenceDiagram autonumber actor U as User / Notebook participant C as Crew participant A as Agent participant L as AnthropicPromptCachingLLM participant API as Anthropic Messages API participant Cache as Anthropic Prompt Cache Note over U: Run the notebook to demo caching U->>C: kickoff(IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController) C->>A: execute Task A->>L: call(IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream) Note right of L: Build payload Note right of L: - model, messages, temperature, max_tokens Note right of L: - system = [IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker] Note right of L: - last system block gets
cache_control: {IoT_Industrial_PLC_Logic} Note right of L: - headers: anthropopic-version (IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController) alt First run (IoT_Industrial_EdgeNode) L->>API: POST /v1/messages (IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream) API->>Cache: Write cached system blocks API-->>L: response + usage{IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream} else Subsequent run within TTL (IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream) L->>API: POST /v1/messages (IoT_Industrial_TelemetryStream) API->>Cache: Read cached system blocks API-->>L: response + usage{IoT_Industrial_PLC_Logic} end L-->>A: assistant text A-->>C: task result C-->>U: result + timing Note over Cache: TTL options Note over Cache: - 5m (IoT_Industrial_ActuatorController) Note over Cache: - 1h (IoT_Industrial_MQTT_Broker) Note over L,API: Cache hit requires: Note over L,API: - Identical system content Note over L,API: - Same model + headers Note over L,API: - Within TTL window.

extra.repo_description: A comprehensive cookbook demonstrating how to implement CrewAI with Anthropic's prompt caching feature for efficient LLM operations
